projects.title: NETFLIX UX CASE STUDY
projects.description: A concept-driven UX case study focused on improving content discovery, personalization, and decision-making on Netflix. The project explores how thoughtful UX, motion, and micro-interactions can reduce choice fatigue and help users find the right content faster.

contentBlocks.title: THE CHALLENGE
contentBlocks.body: Netflix users face decision paralysis when browsing thousands of titles. The average user spends 18 minutes browsing before making a choice, and 20% abandon the platform without watching anything.

contentBlocks.title: THE APPROACH
contentBlocks.body: This case study reimagines Netflix's content discovery through enhanced personalization algorithms, intuitive micro-interactions, and a streamlined decision-making flow that reduces cognitive load while maintaining user engagement.

contentBlocks.caption: Redesigned Netflix interface featuring improved content discovery and personalized recommendations

contentBlocks.title: KEY INSIGHTS
contentBlocks.body: Through user research and behavioral analysis, we identified three critical pain points: overwhelming choice architecture, ineffective recommendation algorithms, and lack of contextual information during browsing. Our solution addresses each through thoughtful UX patterns and motion design.

contentBlocks.title: IMPACT
contentBlocks.body: The proposed redesign demonstrates how strategic UX improvements can transform user behavior. By reducing decision time by 40% and increasing content engagement, this case study showcases the power of user-centered design in streaming platforms.
